Title: Network Engineer III - Infrastructure Reliability
RoleDescription:
Network Engineers at Riot are tasked with administration, implementation, and design of high performance networking systems to support our global player base. They seek to eliminate the need for human interaction with infrastructure by automating deployments, orchestration, management of physical and cloud based networking devices. As a Network Engineer at Riot, you're knowledgeable in how and when to use automation frameworks like Ansible or Salt, you understand the basic concepts of software programming, and readily use code to create tools to make it easier for Rioters to ship code!
As a Staff Network Engineer on the Infrastructure Reliability team, you will be a critical part of our efforts to ensure the scalability, availability, and performance of our global network serving millions of players across the world. This role demands deep network architectural knowledge in the Service Provider space, and strong experience operating global scale infrastructure. You should have strong coding skills, a passion for automation, and a focus on reliability engineering to deliver robust and maintainable systems. You will work on network design, traffic analysis and engineering, maintaining CI/CD pipeline  and creating tools to enhance observability and streamline troubleshooting for core infrastructure services.
Responsibilities:

Designing, deploying, and operating the global network: Plan, build, and maintain both new and existing infrastructure to deliver the best possible experience for our players and internal customers.
Coding and automation: Write clean, efficient, and reusable code to automate operational tasks, improve system reliability, and enable rapid scaling.
Developing customer-centric tooling: Build tools to simplify and streamline the consumption of cloud resources for internal teams, empowering them to innovate faster.
Observability and troubleshooting: Enhance monitoring and logging systems to quickly detect, debug, and resolve issues across our infrastructure.
Mentorship and continuous learning: Guide and mentor junior and senior engineers in systems, cloud, and network engineering, fostering a culture of growth and continuous learning.
Timezone Collaboration: Partner closely with engineers across various timezones to maximize coverage, responsiveness, and global reach.

Required Qualifications: 

5+ years of experience as a senior contributor in a service provider, focused on design and operations for large-scale global networks.
Expertise in protocols such as BGP, IS-IS, label signalling (RSVP-TE, Segment Routing, LDP), MPLS VPNs (both layer 2 and layer 3), multicast signalling.
Experienced in operating large-scale web services with strong expertise in OSI layers 47 technologies and global load balancing strategies.
QoS experience across multiple vendor hardware implementations.
Troubleshooting and Incident Response: Skilled at troubleshooting live incidents, with a proactive approach to minimizing downtime and service impact. Familiarity with Root Cause Analysis (RCA) processes to identify, document, and drive long-term solutions to recurring issues.
Automation and Scripting: Proficiency in scripting and programming languages like Python and Golang to drive automation, manage deployments, and create tooling.
Cloud Connectivity: Expertise in AWS connectivity solutions and foundational services (e.g., S3, EC2, EBS). Experience in container management and orchestration with Docker and Kubernetes.
Adaptability: Ability to quickly adopt and adapt to new technologies, frameworks, and cloud-native tools to solve complex problems

Desired Qualifications:

Proven experience leading and mentoring a team of engineers, fostering collaboration and technical growth.
Solid foundation in systems and cloud engineering principles and protocols.
Strong ITIL Foundations

For this role, you'll find success through craft expertise, a collaborative spirit, and decision-making that prioritizes your fellow Rioters, who are the customers of your work. Being a dedicated fan of games is not necessary for this position!

Title: Principal UX Designer, Riot Client
RoleDescription:
As a Principal UX Designer working on Riot Client, you will set the experience design vision for our multi-game experiences across the Riot Ecosystem. Your work will include end-to-end experience design and advocating for player experiences and design opportunities that elegantly resolve valuable player journeys. You'll work from discovery to implementation; collaborating with designers, engineers, product managers, etc to create resonant, anticipatory, and relevant experiences for players. You are a visionary designer who will level up and inspire teams and disciplines across organizations. You are someone who is comfortable operating in the ambiguity of design opportunities, with a deep awareness of our players' needs, and can shape them into actionable pursuits by other designers. 
Player Platform is a product and service org that creates experiences to accelerate game teams; solving common problems that many game teams can benefit from. As a User Experience Designer on the team, you will be a central contributor to defining the teams product and feature vision for our players, and trusted to design solutions that help players have a cohesive and complementary ecosystem experience with Riot owned channels and games. You will work closely with designers across the org and with game teams acting as a go to thought leader in the design space that is able to tame complexity and orchestrate against ambitious bets that are resonant to players. You will report to the Director, User Experience.
 
Responsibilities:

Lead UX design and set the vision across Riot Owned Channels (Riot Client, Riot Mobile, Web). 
Collaborate across the initiative to ensure high quality design can consistently be realised.
Communicate your data-informed vision and design rationale, that has players at the heart of it, to stakeholders and team members in a compelling way.
Deliver appropriate UX design artifacts for the team (e.g., strategy articulation, discovery/ research results, journey maps, Information Architectures (IAs), flows, wireframes, mockups, and interactive prototypes) 
Break down experiences thoughtfully for teams to ship value incrementally (from  Minimum Valuable Experience to Desired Experience), making intentional trade-offs that are grounded in a clear perspective that works towards the optimal player impact.
Establish experiential principals that guides decision making and crafts thoughtful cohesion.
Define key outcomes and metrics that help us understand how well our experiences are enhancing the player experience.
Work with Design discipline leadership across Riot to establish best-practices, quality standards, and champion user-centered design methodologies.

Required Qualifications:

Minimum 8 years industry experience, having led significant portions of the UX of multiple shipped multiplatform online games as a service, or major releases of consumer-facing digital products.
Experience setting product strategy and solving difficult UX problems by creating intuitive interfaces.
Adept at UX prototyping, using interactive design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Figma and prototyping tools.
Comfortable planning and estimating UX effort for projects and programs.
Comfortable switching between design strategy, micro- and macro-level interaction design, and design execution, and taking on roles outside of traditional design, including product management.

Desired Qualifications:

Experience designing interfaces on Mobile, PC, and Console, with strong understanding of interaction modalities across controller, keyboard, mouse, and touch.
Experience designing tooling for publishing workflows.

We tell compelling stories, build trust with our communities, and ensure that every beat - from game launches to major esports tournaments and entertainment expansions - resonates with players worldwide. Experience working with quantitative research tools (e.g., UserTesting, UserInterviews) and survey platforms (e.g., Qualtrics, Sawtooth)
Strong understanding of research quality principles, including sampling, panel health, and data integrity

Own key relationships at senior levels with existing and prospective partners, negotiating complex, high-value deals and ensuring strategic alignment.
Stay ahead of industry trends and emerging technologies in esports, sports, entertainment, and media to drive innovation and new revenue opportunities.
Act as a thought leader within the esports business development space, helping to shape Riots approach to partnerships and monetization.
Mentor and guide junior team members, fostering a culture of collaboration, growth, and best-in-class execution.

8-10+ years of experience in business development, partnerships, or sponsorship sales, with a proven track record of structuring and closing high-value deals in gaming, sports, entertainment, or media.

Expert negotiation and relationship management skills, with the ability to engage and influence senior stakeholders both internally and externally.
Experience leading strategic initiatives, with a deep understanding of sponsorship valuation, content monetization, and brand partnerships.

Title: Manager, Tax
RoleDescription:
Riot Games was established in 2006 by entrepreneurial gamers who believe that player-focused game development can result in great games. In 2009, Riot released its debut title League of Legends to critical and player acclaim. As the most played video game in the world, over 100 million play every month. Players form the foundation of our community and its for them that we continue to evolve and improve the League of Legends experience.
Were looking for humble but ambitious, razor-sharp professionals who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. Like us, you take play seriously; youre passionate about games. We embrace those who see things differently, arent afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints.
That's where you come in.
As a Rioter, youll lead a dedicated team of specialists committed to becoming the most player-focused game company in the world.  Youll join a tight-knit group of exceptionally bright-minded individuals who share our prioritization of player experience, rejection of convention, and passion for gaming. 
As Manager, Tax, reporting to the Senior Director of Asia Tax, Treasury & Finance Operations (FinOps), you will lead the tax initiatives in Korea, oversee strategic tax planning, transfer pricing, tax controversy, and compliance matters, and work closely with the global tax team and other finance functions. 
Responsibilities:
Tax Compliance

Oversee/Manage preparation and filing of tax returns

Corporate income tax and Local income tax
Value added tax
Withholding tax
CbCR and Local File
Other tax compliance as required 

Manage tax provisions for accounting purposes

Prepare monthly tax provisions (DTA/DTL, Payments, CIT/LIT/WHT monthly provisions etc.)
Assess uncertain tax positions


Tax Analysis and Advisory

Review related party transactions and analyze/support arms length prices (cost allocations, etc.)
Advise business teams on all tax-related matters
Identify and mitigate tax risks (structure, new business lines, contract reviews etc.)
Manage and coordinate tax audits/investigations/inquiries

People Manager

Develop, manage, and advocate for operational team members and stakeholders
Partner with Central subject matter experts in creating craft development plans
Apply business acumen and insight as needed for large scale projects where your team plays a key role

Required Qualifications:

Experienced: Bachelors degree in Tax, Accounting, Finance or related fields, 6+ years of corporate tax experience (have experience in leading the tax team)
English speaker: You are fluent in written and spoken English communication.

Fast learner with curiosity: You are curious to learn more about game industry, our products, and eager to further develop yourself to embrace challenges

Strong people manager: You are experienced in managing a team. You know how to motivate them, provide support in daily operation, facilitate communication with other teams and support their career development
Effective collaborator: You possess excellent stakeholder management skills and the ability to proactively identify, analyze, and resolve complex tax issues, drive alignment on strategic tax initiatives, and support business operations. You have strong organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously while working with various teams in a fast-paced environment

Desired Qualifications:

CPA (or equivalent) holder preferred
Experience in game, entertainment, and technology industry
Experience working and effectively partnering with cross-functional teams, including finance, legal, accounting, treasury and business teams
Familiar with Coupa, Concur, and ERP systems
